title: Verify OpenAPI remote URL accessibility
description:
## Problem

The remote URL for the OpenAPI spec is not accessible:
`https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Speechall/speechall-openapi/refs/heads/main/openapi.yaml`

When attempting to use this URL in `fern/generators.yml`, fern check fails with:
```
Missing file: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Speechall/speechall-openapi/refs/heads/main/openapi.yaml
```

## Possible Causes
1. The speechall-openapi repository is private (not public)
2. The repository doesn't exist at that location
3. The branch name is incorrect
4. The file path within the repo is incorrect

## Current Workaround
Using the local path instead:
`../../../Speechall-Repositories/speechall-openapi/openapi.yaml`

## Required Action
1. Verify the speechall-openapi repository exists and is public
2. If private, either make it public or use GitHub tokens for access
3. Update the URL in fern/generators.yml once accessible
4. Test with `fern check` to verify it works
close_reason: Fern limitation: generators.yml doesn't support remote URLs, only local paths. Remote URL is accessible but not usable in this context.

title: Fix Fern output path to generate package.json at root
description:
## Problem

The Fern generator configuration in fern/generators.yml has output path set to '../src', which generates TypeScript source files in the src/ directory but does not update the root package.json file.

According to Fern documentation, when packageJson is configured in generators.yml, the generator should create/update package.json at the output location. Currently:
- Output path: ../src (relative to fern/ directory)
- Result: Source files generated in src/, but package.json in root is not updated
- Expected: package.json should be at the root of the SDK package

## Current Configuration
```yaml
output:
  location: local-file-system
  path: ../src
```

## Expected Configuration
```yaml
output:
  location: local-file-system
  path: ..
```

## Impact
The packageJson configuration in generators.yml (with @speechall/sdk and version 2.0.0) is not being applied to the root package.json file.

## Fix Required
Change the output path from '../src' to '..' so that:
1. package.json is generated/updated at the root
2. Source files are generated in src/ subdirectory (Fern default behavior)
3. The packageJson config values are properly applied

## Verification
After fixing, regenerate and verify:
```bash
./regenerate.sh
grep '"name"' package.json    # Should show '@speechall/sdk'
grep '"version"' package.json  # Should show '2.0.0'
```

```yaml
name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]

jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    strategy:
      matrix:
```

title: Enhance release workflow with safety checks
description:
## Summary
Add safety checks to `.github/workflows/release.yml` to verify version matches release tag and run tests before publishing to npm.

## File to Modify
- `.github/workflows/release.yml`

## Current State
The release workflow is simple and works, but lacks safety checks:
- No version verification (package.json version should match release tag)
- No test run before publishing

## Changes Required
Add two new steps after "Setup Node.js" and before "Publish to npm":

```yaml
      - name: Verify version matches release tag
        run: |
          PACKAGE_VERSION=$(node -p "require('./package.json').version")
          RELEASE_TAG=${GITHUB_REF#refs/tags/v}
          if [ "$PACKAGE_VERSION" != "$RELEASE_TAG" ]; then
            echo "Error: package.json version ($PACKAGE_VERSION) does not match release tag ($RELEASE_TAG)"
            exit 1
          fi
          echo "Version verified: $PACKAGE_VERSION"

      - name: Run tests before publishing
        run: npm test
```

## Full Updated Workflow
```yaml
name: Release

on:
  release:
    types: [published]

jobs:
  publish:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      contents: read
      id-token: write

    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: '20'
          registry-url: 'https://registry.npmjs.org'
          cache: 'npm'

      - name: Verify version matches release tag
        run: |
          PACKAGE_VERSION=$(node -p "require('./package.json').version")
          RELEASE_TAG=${GITHUB_REF#refs/tags/v}
          if [ "$PACKAGE_VERSION" != "$RELEASE_TAG" ]; then
            echo "Error: package.json version ($PACKAGE_VERSION) does not match release tag ($RELEASE_TAG)"
            exit 1
          fi
          echo "Version verified: $PACKAGE_VERSION"

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci

      - name: Build SDK
        run: npm run build

      - name: Run tests before publishing
        run: npm test

      - name: Publish to npm
        run: npm publish --access public
        env:
          NODE_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Version verification step added
- [ ] Tests run before npm publish
- [ ] Release fails if version mismatch
- [ ] Release fails if tests fail

## Dependencies
None - this can be done in parallel with other tasks.
close_reason: Added version verification and test steps to release workflow

title: Update regenerate.sh for remote OpenAPI URL
description:
## Summary
Update `regenerate.sh` to work with the new remote URL approach for OpenAPI spec. Remove the local file path validation since the spec is now fetched remotely by Fern.

## File to Modify
- `regenerate.sh`

## Current State (lines 4-11)
```bash
echo "Validating OpenAPI spec..."
# Check if OpenAPI file exists - UPDATE PATH AS NEEDED
if [ ! -f "../speechall-openapi/openapi.yaml" ]; then
    echo "Error: OpenAPI spec not found at ../speechall-openapi/openapi.yaml"
    exit 1
fi

echo "OpenAPI spec found"
```

This checks for a local file that no longer needs to exist.

## Change Required
Replace lines 4-11 with:
```bash
echo "Validating Fern configuration..."

if [ ! -f "fern/generators.yml" ]; then
    echo "Error: fern/generators.yml not found"
    exit 1
fi

echo "Using OpenAPI spec configured in fern/generators.yml"
echo "Note: The spec is fetched remotely by Fern."
echo "For local OpenAPI changes, temporarily edit fern/generators.yml to use a local path."
```

## Full Updated Script
```bash
#!/bin/bash
set -e

echo "Validating Fern configuration..."

if [ ! -f "fern/generators.yml" ]; then
    echo "Error: fern/generators.yml not found"
    exit 1
fi

echo "Using OpenAPI spec configured in fern/generators.yml"
echo "Note: The spec is fetched remotely by Fern."
echo "For local OpenAPI changes, temporarily edit fern/generators.yml to use a local path."

echo "Generating TypeScript SDK with Fern..."
fern generate --local --force

echo "SDK generation complete!"

# Optional: Run type checking
if [ -f "tsconfig.json" ]; then
    echo "Running TypeScript type check..."
    if command -v npx &> /dev/null; then
        npx tsc --noEmit
    else
        echo "npx not available, skipping type check"
    fi
fi

# Optional: Run tests
if [ -d "tests" ] || [ -d "__tests__" ]; then
    echo "Running tests..."
    if command -v npm &> /dev/null; then
        npm test
    else
        echo "npm not available, skipping tests"
    fi
fi

echo "Regeneration complete!"
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Local path validation removed
- [ ] Fern config file validation added
- [ ] Helpful messages about remote URL approach added
- [ ] Script runs successfully: `./regenerate.sh`

## Dependencies
- Depends on: speechall-typescript-sdk-dsh.4 (OpenAPI path must be updated first)

title: SDK incorrectly parses plain text response when output_format is 'text'
description:
## Problem

When calling `client.speechToText.transcribe()` with `output_format: 'text'`, the API returns plain text (e.g., "amazing things") but the SDK's response parser expects JSON. This results in:

```json
{
  "ok": false,
  "error": {
    "reason": "non-json",
    "statusCode": 200,
    "rawBody": "amazing things"
  }
}
```

## Expected Behavior

The SDK should detect when `output_format: 'text'` is used and handle plain text responses correctly, returning the text string directly.

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Run `npx tsx examples/basic-transcription.ts`
2. Observe the response wraps the actual transcription in an error object

## Notes

This may be a Fern code generation issue - the generated client might need custom handling for non-JSON response types.

title: Release v2.0.0 with Automated Publishing
description:
# Release v2.0.0 with Automated Publishing

## Overview

Prepare the Speechall TypeScript SDK v2.0.0 release with **full automation**: merging to `main` automatically creates a GitHub Release and publishes to npm.

## Current State

- **Package**: `@speechall/sdk` (existing npm package at v1.0.0)
- **Current Code**: Version 0.1.0, package name incorrectly set to `speechall` in Fern config
- **Branch**: `experiment/clean-fern-generation` → merging to `main`
- **Breaking Changes**: Complete SDK rewrite using Fern code generation (API/code changes, NOT package name change)

## Implementation Flow

```
1. Developer updates version in fern/generators.yml to 2.0.0
2. Developer regenerates SDK (./regenerate.sh)
3. Developer commits and merges PR to main
   ↓
4. NEW WORKFLOW: Auto-create GitHub Release with tag v2.0.0
   ↓
5. EXISTING WORKFLOW: Automatically publish to npm
```

## Critical Files

**New Files to Create:**
- `/CHANGELOG.md` - Documents breaking changes, migration guide
- `/.github/workflows/auto-release.yml` - Auto-creates GitHub Releases on merge

**Files to Modify:**
- `/fern/generators.yml` (lines 28-29) - Update name to `@speechall/sdk` and version to `2.0.0`
- `/README.md` - Update package name references from `speechall` to `@speechall/sdk`
- `/package.json` (auto-regenerated) - Will show correct name and version after `./regenerate.sh`

## Regression Verification

✅ **No regressions confirmed** - changing package name is safe:
- All examples and tests use relative imports (`../src`), not package name imports
- Generated code has no hardcoded package name references

## Success Criteria

- [ ] Package published as `@speechall/sdk@2.0.0` on npm
- [ ] GitHub Release created automatically on merge
- [ ] CHANGELOG.md documents breaking changes and migration guide
- [ ] Can install: `npm install @speechall/sdk`
- [ ] CI passes on main

title: Auto-release workflow doesn't trigger npm publish due to GITHUB_TOKEN limitation
description:
## Problem

When auto-release.yml creates a GitHub release using the default GITHUB_TOKEN, it doesn't trigger the release.yml workflow (which publishes to npm). This is a GitHub Actions security feature to prevent infinite workflow loops.

## Solution Options

1. **Use a Personal Access Token (PAT)**: Create a PAT with 'contents: write' permission and use it instead of GITHUB_TOKEN in auto-release.yml
2. **Use repository dispatch**: Have auto-release.yml trigger a repository_dispatch event that release.yml listens to
3. **Merge workflows**: Combine auto-release and npm publish into a single workflow

## Workaround

For now, manually trigger npm publish by:
- Deleting and recreating the GitHub release, OR
- Running npm publish locally with proper credentials
close_reason: Fixed using repository_dispatch: auto-release.yml now triggers npm-publish event after creating GitHub release, and release.yml listens for both release:published and repository_dispatch events

title: Create auto-release GitHub workflow
description:
## Overview
Create a new GitHub Actions workflow that automatically creates GitHub Releases when code is merged to main.

## File to Create
`/.github/workflows/auto-release.yml`

## Workflow Requirements

### Trigger
- On push to `main` branch (after PR merge)

### Steps
1. Extract version from `package.json` (e.g., `2.0.0`)
2. Check if release already exists for this version (idempotency)
3. Create a git tag (e.g., `v2.0.0`)
4. Generate release notes from CHANGELOG.md
5. Create GitHub Release with the tag

### Key Features
- **Idempotent**: Won't recreate if release already exists
- **Version extraction**: Reads version dynamically from package.json
- **CHANGELOG integration**: Uses CHANGELOG.md for release notes
- **Safe**: Only runs on main branch after merge

### Integration
This workflow triggers the existing `release.yml` workflow which handles npm publishing.

## Reference
Look at existing `.github/workflows/release.yml` for npm publishing logic - this new workflow should complement it.

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Workflow file created at `.github/workflows/auto-release.yml`
- [ ] Triggers on push to main
- [ ] Extracts version from package.json
- [ ] Creates git tag with `v` prefix
- [ ] Creates GitHub Release with CHANGELOG content
- [ ] Idempotent (doesn't fail if release exists)

title: Initialize Fern and configure generators
description:
Initialize Fern CLI and set up the core configuration files for TypeScript SDK generation.

## Prerequisites
- Fern CLI installed: `npm install -g fern-api` or `brew install fern-api/tap/fern`
- Verify with: `fern --version`

## Tasks

### 1. Initialize Fern
```bash
fern init
```
This creates the `fern/` directory with default configuration.

### 2. Configure `fern/fern.config.json`
```json
{
    "organization": "speechall",
    "version": "0.84.6"
}
```
Note: Check latest version at https://github.com/fern-api/fern/releases

### 3. Configure `fern/generators.yml`
```yaml
# yaml-language-server: $schema=https://schema.buildwithfern.dev/generators-yml.json
api:
  specs:
    - openapi: ../../speechall-openapi/openapi.yaml

default-group: local

groups:
  local:
    generators:
      - name: fernapi/fern-typescript-sdk
        version: 3.42.0
        output:
          location: local-file-system
          path: ../src
        config:
          namespaceExport: Speechall
          enableInlineTypes: true
          generateWireTests: true
          neverThrowErrors: false
          skipResponseValidation: false
          treatUnknownAsAny: false
          outputSourceFiles: true
          packageJson:
            name: speechall
            version: 0.1.0
            description: "TypeScript SDK for Speechall API - Speech-to-text transcription service"
            author: Speechall
            license: MIT
            repository:
              type: git
              url: "https://github.com/Speechall/speechall-typescript-sdk"
            homepage: "https://docs.speechall.com"
            keywords:
              - speechall
              - speech-to-text
              - transcription
              - api
              - sdk
```

**IMPORTANT**: Verify the OpenAPI spec path. If it's not at `../../speechall-openapi/openapi.yaml`, locate it and update the path accordingly.

### 4. Validate configuration
```bash
fern check
```

```bash
#!/bin/bash
set -e

# Check if OpenAPI file exists - UPDATE PATH AS NEEDED
if [ ! -f "../speechall-openapi/openapi.yaml" ]; then
    echo "Error: OpenAPI spec not found at ../speechall-openapi/openapi.yaml"
    exit 1
fi

echo "OpenAPI spec found"

echo "Generating TypeScript SDK with Fern..."
fern generate --local --force

echo "SDK generation complete!"

# Optional: Run type checking
if [ -f "tsconfig.json" ]; then
    echo "Running TypeScript type check..."
    if command -v npx &> /dev/null; then
        npx tsc --noEmit
    else
        echo "npx not available, skipping type check"
    fi
fi

# Optional: Run tests
if [ -d "tests" ] || [ -d "__tests__" ]; then
    echo "Running tests..."
    if command -v npm &> /dev/null; then
        npm test
    else
        echo "npm not available, skipping tests"
    fi
fi

echo "Regeneration complete!"
```

```bash
chmod +x regenerate.sh
```

Configure GitHub Actions for CI validation and npm publishing.

## Prerequisites
- **Depends on**: speechall-typescript-sdk-vi2.5 (SDK generation must be working)
- Repository should already have `.github/` directory

## Tasks

### 1. Create CI Workflow

Create `.github/workflows/ci.yml`:

```yaml
name: CI

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: '20'

      - name: Install Fern CLI
        run: npm install -g fern-api

      - name: Check OpenAPI spec
        run: fern check

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci

      - name: Build
        run: npm run build

      - name: Test
        run: npm test
```

### 2. Create Release/Publish Workflow (Optional)

If you want automatic npm publishing on release, create `.github/workflows/release.yml`:

```yaml
name: Release

on:
  release:
    types: [published]

jobs:
  publish:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: '20'
          registry-url: 'https://registry.npmjs.org'

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: npm ci

      - name: Build
        run: npm run build

      - name: Publish
        run: npm publish --access public
        env:
          NODE_AUTH_TOKEN: ${{ secrets.NPM_TOKEN }}
```

### 3. Alternative: Regenerate on OpenAPI Changes

If OpenAPI spec is in the same repo, add `.github/workflows/regenerate.yml`:

```yaml
name: Regenerate SDK

on:
  push:
    paths:
      - 'openapi.yaml'
      - 'fern/**'

jobs:
  regenerate:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: '20'

      - name: Install Fern CLI
        run: npm install -g fern-api

      - name: Generate SDK
        run: fern generate --local --force

      - name: Commit changes
        run: |
          git config user.name "github-actions[bot]"
          git config user.email "github-actions[bot]@users.noreply.github.com"
          git add src/
          git diff --staged --quiet || git commit -m "chore: regenerate SDK from OpenAPI spec"
          git push
```

## Important Notes
- Requires `NPM_TOKEN` secret for npm publishing
- Adjust Node.js version if needed
- Update OpenAPI spec path if it differs

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `.github/workflows/ci.yml` exists
- [ ] CI workflow validates on push/PR to main
- [ ] CI runs `fern check`, builds, and tests
- [ ] (Optional) Release workflow for npm publishing

## Reference
See `history/TYPESCRIPT_SDK_GUIDE.md` GitHub Actions Integration section
close_reason: GitHub Actions workflows created: ci.yml for continuous integration with Fern validation, release.yml for npm publishing on GitHub releases, and regenerate.yml for automatic SDK regeneration. Old auto-release-simple.yml deprecated.

title: Fix OpenAPI spec: rename 'timestamp_granularities[]' to 'timestamp_granularities'
description:
The OpenAPI specification file has a field named 'timestamp_granularities[]' which includes brackets in the field name. This causes issues with code generation as the brackets are interpreted as array notation rather than part of the property name.

## Problem

In the OpenAPI spec at '../speechall-openapi/openapi.yaml', the field is defined as:
```yaml
timestamp_granularities[]:
  description: >
    The timestamp granularities to populate...
  type: array
  items:
    type: string
```

This generates TypeScript code like:
```typescript
if (request.timestamp_granularities[] != null) {  // Syntax error!
```

## Solution

Rename the field in the OpenAPI spec from `timestamp_granularities[]` to `timestamp_granularities` (without brackets). The array type should be specified only in the `type: array` declaration, not in the field name.

## Workaround Applied

The generated TypeScript SDK code has been manually fixed to use bracket notation:
```typescript
if (request["timestamp_granularities[]"] != null) {
```

However, this is a temporary fix. The OpenAPI spec should be corrected at the source.
